cyclone.name: CRISTOBAL
cyclone.current_location: about 155 miles WSW of Campeche, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly drifting south-southwest over the southern Bay of Campeche through Thursday, then forecast to lift northward across the central Gulf of Mexico toward the U.S. Gulf Coast this weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: U.S. central Gulf Coast (likely Louisiana area)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southern Bay of Campeche coast of Mexico and, later in the period, the U.S. Gulf Coast from Texas to Mississippi
weather_observation.wind: Remnant system could bring occasional gusts 20–30 mph early next week, but no tropical-storm-force winds are expected at the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: None – port is inland and far from any coastal surge influence
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of moderate to briefly heavy rain possible 8–10 Jun as remnants pass; widespread totals generally below 2 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated river/stream rises or localized flooding in low-lying areas if heavier rain bands reach the Missouri River basin
